{"id":886821874,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"4Â months","timestamp":1674909626,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"48 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/886821874/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"90 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    vector<int> mergeSorted(vector<int> nums1, vector<int> nums2) {\n        int m = nums1.size();\n        int n = nums2.size();\n\n        vector<int> ans(m+n);\n        int i=0, j=0, k=0;\n\n        while(i < m && j < n) {\n            if(nums1[i] < nums2[j]) {\n                ans[k++] = nums1[i++];\n            }\n\n            else {\n                ans[k++] = nums2[j++];\n            }\n        }\n\n        while(i < m) {\n            ans[k++] = nums1[i++];\n        }\n\n        while(j < n) {\n            ans[k++] = nums2[j++];\n        }\n\n        return ans;\n    }\n    double findMedianSortedArrays(vector<int>& nums1, vector<int>& nums2) {\n        vector<int> ans = mergeSorted(nums1, nums2);\n        int size = ans.size();\n\n        if(size & 1) return ans[size/2];\n        else {\n            double res = (ans[size/2-1] + ans[size/2]) / 2.0;\n            return res;\n        }\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays","has_notes":false}
